## Top level farmer decision flowchart
The overall farmer decision making process is shown below. Each farmer goes through this sequence each model time step. **Note** that the [aging and succession](01c-farmer-aging-and-succession.qmd) step may also result in all of farm land use change, which follows the same general procedure described in [Farmer decisions about land use](04-farmer-decisions-land-use.qmd). Click on the red text to find out what happens in each 'behavioural mode'.

```{mermaid}
flowchart TB
  A((START))
  B[Age farmers and<br>replace any that exit]
  C[Update income, costs, and<br>profit of holdings and farms]
  E[/For each<br>farmer.../]
  F[Debt-service ratio DSR &larr;<br><span style='font-family:monospace;'>current-debt / current-income</span>]
  G1{DSR &geq;<br>1.00 ?}
  G2{DSR &geq;<br>0.50 ?}
  G3{DSR &geq;<br>0.25 ?}
  H1[<span style='color:red;'>Exit<br>market]
  H2[<span style='color:red;'>Survival<br>mode</span>]
  H3[<span style='color:red;'>Constrained<br>mode</span>]
  H4[<span style='color:red;'>Optimisation<br>mode</span>]
  N{More<br>farmers?}
  Z((END))
  A --> B
  B --> C
  C --> E
  E --> F
  F --> G1
  G1 -->|N| G2
  G1 -->|Y| H1
  G2 -->|N| G3
  G2 -->|Y| H2
  G3 -->|N| H4
  G3 -->|Y| H3
  H1 --> N
  H2 --> N
  H3 --> N
  H4 --> N
  N -->|Y| E
  N -->|N| Z
  click H1 "03b-exit-market-succession.html" "Click for details"
```
